Package javelin.model.world.location.unique.minigame

Class Ziggurat

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.fortification.Fortification
          • javelin.model.world.location.unique.UniqueLocation
            • javelin.model.world.location.unique.minigame.Ziggurat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Ziggurat
extends UniqueLocation
    A mini-game vaguely inspired by Z by the Bitmap Brothers in which a map is segmented in several sections. The player starts in the southwesternmost and also controls the segment north and east. Each segment represents a Monster type, so the player has 3 types at his disposal when the match starts. Every time a new, unexplored segment in entered an enemy group is formed from the not-captured segments north, east, south and west of the current segment (and the current one too, of course). Monsters are positioned in the given passage between segments. Once a battle finishes the player can rebuild his team with units from any of the segments he has captured before, up to the Encounter Level of the current segment (next fight). The objective is to reach and conquer the northeastmost segment. Every time a Run is completed a TempleKey to a locked Temple spawns to be taken via interact(). A player may also choose to sacrifice this key to be teleported to the location of any Temple.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
